channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Neverending fly tipping., 14th September
item.description:
The local cleaner put out a radiator which should have been taken away by a central heating engineer and disposed of properly. This as usual then attracted other people to dump their crap including an old carpet and a cardboard box that should be recycled. Idiotic lazy behaviour that just goes on and on.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pitman Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Safe dumped on One Tree Hill.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Park, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeat report after 6 months - No action to put double yellow line end markings in Mays Hill Rd jct Colebrook Rise, Shortlands, 14th September
item.description:
14/8/25 - No action has been taken regarding my report and request on 7/2/25, six months ago, for the corner double yellow lines to be correctly terminated with end bars in Mays Hill Rd, Shortlands, at the junction with where the Colebrook Rise Housing Association owned access road commences. What the Housing Association put on their road is up to them. Bromley Council is legally required to mark and enforce road restrictions according to Statute This is a junction with a bending, limited visibility exit, heavily parked and a fast moving road. Bromley Council has rightly decided to improve visibility and road safety by putting parking restrictions here. However the double yellow lines on the public highway are incorrectly terminated and therefore unenforceable. How long does it take to paint two short yellow lines? I have seen a parking warden issue a ticket here, but the restriction is unenforceable as the double yellow lines are incorrectly painted. Please attend to this road marking error now. It has been 6 months of inaction. Previous report link: Https://fix.bromley.gov.uk/report/7102799

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colebrook Rise, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Since a very long time now my rubbish bins been collected in a very terrible way, my food waste bin has been broken twice because people who empty them are throwing them away anywhere, it’s a huge shame because I pay a lot of money for this service, 14th September
item.description:
I would like to ask for more careful bins collection, my food bin has been damaged and it’s not the first time that this happened. I pay a lot of money for this service so I would like to ask you politely to stop damaging those bins by throwing them away and absolutely anywhere not even on the driveway,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 161, Penhill Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Full overflowing litter bin again, 14th September
item.description:
Frequent site of overflowing litter bin, often leads to detritus all over the public footpath. Would benefit from another bin on the next lamppost or at the bus stop. Someone has placed a shopping basket near the bin which is being used as a secondary bin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on pedestrian crossing, 14th September
item.description:
This graffiti has been here for at least since 3rd September when I took this photo. The red paint is making the pedestrian crossing less safe as it’s less easy for pedestrians and drivers to see. I saw a child run into the road as they didn’t see it was a crossing, endangering their life.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large flytip, 14th September
item.description:

item.title: Traffic Lights Sequence issue, 14th September
item.description:
I assume the sensor on the bus lane traffic light is faulty as the lights are changing with no bus present. This is causing an unnecessary build up of traffic on London road. This issue has been present for over two months now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, South Stifford, Grays
Report on FixMyStreet
